intro: Amsinckia albicarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited fennel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
